III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Unknown staff gave youth wine.
Investigation I reviewed intake dated 06/30/2023. It states that on an unknown
date sometime ago that a former unknown staff person gave
Youth A some wine. It is unknown where it took place in the
facility. When asked about the alleged incident later, Youth A
denied it ever happening and got angry. Complainant and Case
Manager report no other additional concerns.
I interviewed Youth A onsite with DHHS Worker on 07/03/2023.
He reports being placed at the facility in 04/2023. He denies staff
ever giving him wine while at the facility and does not know why
someone would state such an allegation. He denies having
knowledge of any resident being given contraband by staff. He
reports he and other residents have attempted to give staff money
to purchase such items as potato chips and Brisk iced teas.
Youth A goes on to report the physician prescribing another
unknown resident the nicotine patch and gum on one occasion.
I interviewed Manager onsite with DHHS Worker on 07/03/2023a
and 07/28/2023. She has no knowledge of any former or current
staff giving Youth A or any other residents wine. She also states
that residents are not allowed to have money in their possession
while at the facility. She reports residents on occasion being in
possession of money which she states comes from youth’s prior
placement, pan handling while on AWOL, or from visitors.
I interviewed Staff Person 1, via telephone, with DHHS Worker on
07/05/2023. She does not have any knowledge of a former or
current staff person giving any residents wine or any other form of
contraband. Staff Person 1 was interviewed because DHHS
Worker was required to interview another staff person per policy.
DHHS Worker reports no actions taken by her department.
2

Analysis There is no evidence of Youth A being given wine by a former or
current staff member. Youth A denies ever being given wine by a
staff member and does not know of any resident to have received
wine or any contraband as well.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
